results.p: 8 days ago — 1. to give up, refuse, or resign usually by formal declaration; renounce his errors. 2. to refuse to follow, obey, or recognize any further : repudiate.

results.t: RENOUNCE | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: RENOUNCE meaning: 1. to say formally or publicly that you no longer own, support, believe in, or have a connection…. Learn more.
To renounce is to officially give up or turn away from. If you decide to become a vegetarian, you will renounce hamburgers and bacon.
1. to say especially in a formal or official way that you will no longer have or accept (something) : to formally give up (something)

verb (used with object) · to give up or put aside voluntarily: to renounce worldly pleasures. Synonyms: quit, leave, forswear, forgo, forsake. Antonyms: claim.
